name: Root
description: Roots function in the absorption of water and inorganic nutrients, anchoring the plant body to the substrate and supporting it, storage of food and nutrients, and vegetative reproduction.
icon.name: carrot
color.name: grey

name: Leaf
description: Leaves are the main photosynthetic organs of the plant. They are the primary sites of photosynthesis, the process by which plants synthesize food.
icon.name: leaf
color.name: green

name: Stems
description: Stems are the main structural axes of the plant body. They are the primary organs of the shoot system, and they provide structural support, conduct water, minerals, and food, and store food.
icon.name: plant-wilt
color.name: yellow

name: Flower
description: The flower is the reproductive unit of the plant. It is the site where the reproductive organs are located.
icon.name: fan
color.name: pink

name: Fruit
description: The fruit is the mature ovary of a flowering plant. It usually contains seeds, which are the plant's means of reproduction.
icon.name: lemon
color.name: red

name: Seed
description: A seed is a plant embryo and food reserve enclosed in a protective outer covering called a seed coat.
icon.name: seedling
color.name: brown

name: Bud
description: A bud is an undeveloped shoot or flower. It is a small, undeveloped structure that can develop into a new shoot or flower.
icon.name: flower-bud
color.name: green

name: Bark
description: Bark is the outer protective layer of the stem and branches of a tree or shrub. It protects the plant from physical damage and disease.
icon.name: tree
color.name: grey

name: Whole organism
description: The whole organism is the complete individual plant, including all of its parts.
icon.name: person
color.name: grey
